name: sl-external-editor
description: Integrate vs code with the Second Life client external editor feature

commands.title: SL External Editor: Update LSP Defs

secondlifeExternalEditor.enabled.description:
Wether the extension should be enabled.
Reconmend setting this in workspace rather than globally

secondlifeExternalEditor.dir.projects.description: The directory path the extension will use to look for projects to automatically open for

secondlifeExternalEditor.hints.prefix.markdownDescription:
The prefix character after a comment that the extension will use to look for hints as to how to handle the file

e.g. `--@project <project_name>`
Suported Hints
|Hint|Description|
|----|----|
|`project`|The folder in the projects dir to look in|
|`path`|The path on the system to look in, (overrides project)|
|`file`|The file in project or path to link to|

secondlifeExternalEditor.watcher.tempFil.markdownDescription:
Wether the the script must start with the direcotry name before the file name
e.g. Script in folder `project_name/main.luau` will require the script in sl to be named like `project_name main` or `project_name/main`
This can be bypassed with hints

secondlifeExternalEditor.watcher.fileExt.description: What file extensions should the be monitored for

secondlifeExternalEditor.preprocessor.wa.markdownDescription: **NOT IMPLEMENTED YET**: Wether the extension should monitor included files via #include, or preprocessor file list output

secondlifeExternalEditor.preprocessor.co.markdownDescription:
**NOT IMPLEMENTED YET**: Command to execute as a preprocessor when files change, the output of this will be put into the temp file the viewer created

Supports the following replacements

|Replacement|Description|
|----|----|
|`%script%`|The path of the file for the preprocessor to start on|
|`%out%`|The file to ouput to, if specified extension fill look for writes to that file for the output rather than `std_out`|
|`%lang%`|The language that the extension believes the script is|

e.g. `python ~/sl/LSL-PyOptimizer/main.py --bom %script%`

secondlifeExternalEditor.download.markdownDescription: Wether extension should download SLua Type Defs

secondlifeExternalEditor.download.locati.markdownDescription: Where downloaded definition files should be put for your projectm (selene cannot be global, and will default to root)
markdownEnumDescriptions: Store in vscodes global config location
Put the type def files at the root level of your workspace
Put the type def files in the .vscode folder
Put the type def files in a folder called '.types'

secondlifeExternalEditor.luau-lsp.downlo.markdownDescription: Url's to download SLua type definition files for the luau-lsp from.
Url's to download SLua documentation files for the luau-lsp from.

secondlifeExternalEditor.selene.download.markdownDescription: Url's to download SLua Selene Standard Library files from
